title: Lissandra's passive is screaming for a rework.
body:
Iceborn - "Every 18 seconds, Lissandra's next ability costs no mana. Cooldown reduction does not affect Iceborn, but the cooldown is reduced by 1 second whenever Lissandra impairs an enemy's movement with an ability (does not apply to movement-impairing effects from items)."

               With over 120,000 mastery on my favorite champion, what I say comes from the very soul. I have  _rarely_  felt the actual impact of Lissandra's passive. Not in lane phase, not in mid game, and **most defintely** not in team fights. The passive is so inconsistent that my own highlight experiences culminate with; "!! my ultimate was randomly free and now I have enough mana to throw an extra Q. neat!" But is "neat" really what the devs are looking for in champion design? The name itself sounds sinister, but often comes up short of fulfilling Lissandra's fantasy of "Ice witch." Lately champion design has traveled to the realm of "real and interesting moment by moment interactive decisions". Lissandra's uninteresting and less than interactive passive is truly a relic of the past. 

              Realistically, the passive is self defeating. A passive that requires more mana to receive less mana? It just feels wrong, and doesn't fit with her kit. So many exciting and **balanced** routes could be taken with her passive. An underwhelming and inconsistent passive just doesn't fit the bill. 

Thoughts? Any fellow Lissandra mains?

Edit: Please don't assume that I have no idea how to use the passive to it's fullest current iteration. Currently I use it to poke efficiently in lane, and nab a few minions before backing when OOM. It feels so linear and frankly, gating, to the true potential of the ICE WITCH.

I mentioned a few months ago that Lissandra's passive, as an Iceborn, should enhance her abilities.

Iceborn	STATIC COOLDOWN: 18
Lissandra's next ability periodically has no cost and is enhanced.

Ice Shard: Now slows all affected targets by 16 / 19 / 22 / 25 / 28%
Ring of Frost: Increases radius and duration by 50%, up to 1.65 / 1.80 / 1.95 / 2.10 / 2.25
Glacial Path: Travels twice as fast, as well as refunding 30% of its cooldown
Frozen Tomb: Dark ice expands and covers its area of effect instantly

Granted these changes might be a little too strong, but it can be adjusted as needed. At least it adds some spice and flavor to her passive, on top of her original passive so that she can keep high mana cost on Q instead of abusing its slow and damage with a low mana output.
